content: On August 23, 1982, the Atlanta Braves achieved a significant milestone by clinching a spot in the postseason for the first time since moving to Atlanta, securing their place in the National League Championship Series. The Braves, led by manager Bobby Cox, won the NL West title that year, marking a resurgence for the franchise. This season was pivotal, as it set the stage for a successful decade in Braves history, culminating in multiple division titles and World Series appearances.
